member.name: P:BytecodeApi.CachedProperty`1.Value

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.AddBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that adds the specified number of business days to this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are added, otherwise days are subtracted.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be added to this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the sum of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.SubtractBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns a new that subtracts the specified number of business days from this value. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The calculation is iterative. If is positive, days are subtracted, otherwise days are added.
Example 1: Friday + 2 business days = Tuesday
Example 2: Monday - 2 business days = Thursday
member.param: The original value.
A value specifying the business days to be subtracted from this object.
member.returns: A new object whose value is the difference of this value and the specified business days.

member.name: M:BytecodeApi.Extensions.DateTimeExtensions.GetTotalBusinessDays(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Computes the total count of business days between two instances. Business days exclude Saturday and Sunday. The time fraction is ignored and the returned value is inclusive.
Example 1: Friday through Tuesday = 3 business days
Example 2: Saturday through Sunday = 0 business days
member.param: The value to compare to .
The value to compare to this . can be either less or greater than this value.
member.returns: A value representing the total count of business days between two instances.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.ElevationType.Limited

member.name: T:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the display format for byte size values to be used in formatting logic.

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat.ByteSize
member.summary:
Specifies that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with no decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat.ByteSizeTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies that the closest unit (Bytes, KB, MB, GB, TB, ...) is displayed. The result is rounded with two decimal places.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12,06 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat.Bytes
member.summary:
Specifies that the exact amount of bytes is displayed. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "12.345 bytes"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat.KiloBytes
member.summary:
Specifies that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded up. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.name: F:BytecodeApi.Text.ByteSizeFormat.KiloBytesTwoDigits
member.summary:
Specifies that the value is displayed as kilobytes. The result is rounded with two decimal places. A thousands separator is displayed as a dot.
Example: 12345 is converted to "13 KB"

member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum number sentences used to build text.
The default value is 20

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.LineBreakChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a linebreak being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0f means no linebreaks and 1.0f means a linebreak between every sentence.
The default value is 0.0f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.TextGenerator.ParagraphChance
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that specifies the chance of a paragraph being inserted after a sentence, where 0.0f means no paragraphs and 1.0f means a paragraph between every sentence. Randomly picked paragraphs have precedence over linebreaks and do not occur consecutively.
The default value is 0.1f

member.name: P:BytecodeApi.Text.SentenceGenerator.FinishPunctuation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the characters that are used for punctuation after a sentence. Including a character multiple times increases the chance for this character. For example, this can be used to increase the likelihood of a period over a question mark or exclamation mark. Character order is not relevant.
The default value is "...?!"
